title: Firefox stopped working after uninstalling Edge and Office 365
content:
Hello. I un-installed Microsoft Edge and Office 365 and now Firefox has stopped working (on another computer not this one).

This is the same problem that someone reported in 2021, but that thread has been archived.

https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1356550

The advice then was to re-install Firefox and to download Visual C++ \ Visual Studio files ( especially VCRuntime1401.dll).

My problem is that I don't have a browser on that computer, I am completely cut off from the internet and can't download anything.

Is it possible to download the necessary files on this computer and transfer them to the one that has the problem? Thanks.
creator: colin_hodgson

title: Titlebar buttons missing, if running Firefox in CentOS7/Gnome, and accessed via RDP from Windows 10 Enterprise
content:
My setup: A remote server running CentOS Linux 7 and Firefox Browser 102.7.0esr (64-bit), accessed via RDP from a Windows 10 Enterprise laptop (No tablet)

Up in the top right corner of the Mozilla Firefox window, I have only the close button, the Minimize and the Maximize buttons are missing. In the same gnome (desktop) environment, all other running windows has those buttons available.

Note: if toggle enable or disable those buttons “Minimize” & “Maximize” [command: gnome-tweaks > Windows > "Tilebar Buttons" > toggle] , all running windows in gnome will be affected correctly, except the Firefox window, no impact. Reinstall Firefox did not help.

This behavior started after our latest yum update recently.

When connected directly to the Linux server, there are no issues, the buttons are available. (i.e., no RDP involved)

firefox-102.7.0-1.el7.centos.x86_64 xrdp-0.9.21-1.el7.x86_64

Br. Peter
creator: peter.medic

title: Trackpoint 'side-scroll' opens new window
content:
Hi there,

When using my Thinkpas X13s trackpoint to scroll 'sideways' with the Trackpoint+middle mouse button (i.e. from left to right) a new blank Firefox window opens up. So, when trying to scroll downwards all is well but the slight deviation and Firefox opens many new windows. I mean, many (like 5, because of the 'continuous' scroll).

Community solutions have as of yet not brought any luck. Any help is appreciated, thanks.

Joris
creator: J_sebas

title: Credit Card Autofill
content: I leave the country for several months a year to a country that is not supported for credit card autofill, and it doesn't work while I am there. However, once I return to the U.S. the autofill menu has disappeared from the Privacy & Security Tab, so I am unable to turn autofill back on. In the past I have had to uninstall/reinstall Firefox to make credit card autofill work -- until I leave the country again. Surely I am not the only user that has had this problem and having to uninstall/reinstall is a pain that users shouldn't have. Isn't there a better way to turn this function on and off?
creator: tmccaffery

title: Možnost označit více položek ve složce pro otevření jedním klikem.
content:
Dobrý den,

jsem zvyklý ukládat linky do záložek a v nich jsou i desítky složek a linků. Dle pravidla, že obrázek vydá za x stránek popisu přikládám výřezy: "Záložky_Firefox.png" a přiklad jedné z nich "Složka_Firefox.png".

Uvítal bych, kdyby bylo možno označit více řádků (složek, linků) v záložce. Ideálně nastavit myš na položku (složku, link v záložce) za současného stisku Ctrl nebo Shift a klikem je označit. Pak pravým tačítkem myši otevřít všechny vybrané položky. V současné době lze pravým tlačítkem myši pouze ´Otevřít všechny záložky´ - viz "Otevřít všechny záložky_Firefox.png".

Věřím, že by tuto vlastnost uvítalo více uživatelů.

Nejsem si jist, ale ve starší verzi Firefox (několik let nazpět) tato možnost byla. Možná to bylo v Chrome, který jsem před léty nějakou dobu používal.

S pozdravem a přáním příjemného dne

Miroslav Slíva

P.S. Mám nainstalován Firefox Browser 111.0.1 (64 bitů) - k dnešnímu dni aktuální.
creator: msliva

title: Not Synching Everything Between Devices
content:
Hi,

I've imported all bookmarks, login data and everything else from Brave browser to Firefox and I can use Firefox as if I'm using Brave. All my data have been imported. Until here everything is ok, but I switched my pc and started to use Firefox with my Firefox account and enabled sync. Boookmarks and login information that I saved before importing have been synched but the imported data haven't been synched. So I can't use any login info or bookmarks from old Brave.

I've double checked sync options and see that everything that can be synched are checked.

What can I do to fully synchonise my browsers?

title: Edit cookies resend in new panel
content: [Devtools] You have been enabled new edit and resend panel by default, its a panel won't allow users edit some fields of headers. However, in the old panel, we can do what ever we want, like modify the cookies of the new request. I wonder why you just disabled those fields? Are there any settings I can set to make those fields editable? It's a really bad design for developers who definitely will need to edit those protected headers.
